greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write n=x+y (x,y>0) with 6x-1, 6x+1, 6y+1 and 6y+5 all prime
comment: This has been verified for n up to 10^9. It implies that there are infinitely many twin primes and also infinitely many cousin primes, since the interval [m!+2,m!+m] of length m-2 contains no prime for any integer m>1.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Zhi-Wei Sun, Conjectures involving primes and quadratic forms, arXiv:1211.1588.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Jan 03 2013
